  • Method Details

    • weatherReport

      public WeatherReportApi.WeatherReportAdapter weatherReport(List<com.here.platform.data.client.base.ols.generated.scaladsl.model.weather.WeatherProduct.Product> products, Optional<String> xRequestId, Optional<String> q, Optional<String> zipCode, Optional<String> location, Optional<String> units, Optional<Boolean> oneObservation, Optional<com.here.platform.data.client.base.ols.generated.scaladsl.model.weather.DateOrTime> hourlyDate, Optional<String> lang, Optional<String> politicalView)
      Retrieves weather reports, weather forecasts, severe weather alerts.

      Path: /report

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : WeatherReport (OK) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 401 : AuthError (API response in case of lacking valid authorization credentials.) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 403 : AuthError (API response in case of insufficient credentials for access to the requested resource.) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Invalid parameters were provided) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 429 : ErrorResponse (API response in case of too many requests) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (API response in case of internal server error) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 502 : ErrorResponse (API response in case of bad gateway) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 503 : ErrorResponse (API response in case of service unavailable) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      code 504 : ErrorResponse (API response in case of gateway timeout.) Headers : X-Correlation-Id - X-Request-Id -

      Parameters:
      products - A parameter identifying the type of report to obtain. Comma separated values.
      xRequestId - User-provided token that can be used to trace a request or a group of requests sent to the service.
      q - Enter a free-text query. Examples: \"125, Berliner, berlin\", \"Beacon, Boston\"
      zipCode - ZIP code of the location. This parameter is supported only for locations in the United States of America. Latitude and longitude, name, or zipcode must be present.
      location - Geographical location in WGS-84-compliant format. Specifying the area covered by the weather report. Format: {lat},{lng}
      units - Units of measurement used. The default is metric.
      oneObservation - Boolean, if set to true, the response only includes the closest location. Only available when the product parameter is set to observation. The default is false.
      hourlyDate - Date for which hourly forecasts are to be retrieved. The format is YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
      lang - Defines the language used in the descriptions in the response. For example, the response for a query with lang=de-DE has descriptions in German. The default is en-US.
      politicalView - Specify the political view. Available territories are seen through the point of view of this country. If this parameter is not specified, the neutral international view is made available, where territories may have unresolved claims. This parameter accepts single ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code. The country codes are to be provided in all uppercase. Currently the only supported political view is CHN. Any political view that is unsupported falls back to the default view. For example, politicalView=USA or politicalView=FRA does not impact a response in any way.
